description:
A poor man's 16803 image! This is 6 panels through the QSI683 camera of the Great Carina Nebula, NGC 3372. Using drizzle integration and pixinisght's mosaic has brought the resolution down to around a third of an arc second per pixel. It's too big for the astrometry server - so here's the detail from pixinisghts image solver.



Image Plate Solver script version 5.0
===============================================================================
Referentiation Matrix (Gnomonic projection = Matrix * Coords[x,y]):
            -0.00010533        -5.78386e-06           +0.654881
           +5.68214e-06        -0.000105324           +0.636186
                     +0                  +0                  +1
Projection origin.. [5868.376639 6356.893413]px -> [RA:10 44 44.060 Dec:-59 55 42.14]
Resolution ........ 0.380 arcsec/px
Rotation .......... 3.116 deg
Focal ............. 2933.16 mm
Pixel size ........ 5.40 um
Field of view ..... 1d 14' 17.4" x 1d 20' 27.6"
Image center ...... RA: 10 44 44.030  Dec: -59 55 41.98
Image bounds:
   top-left ....... RA: 10 49 51.771  Dec: -59 17 09.29
   top-right ...... RA: 10 40 11.368  Dec: -59 13 14.06
   bottom-left .... RA: 10 49 28.491  Dec: -60 37 33.21
   bottom-right ... RA: 10 39 24.260  Dec: -60 33 28.12
===============================================================================
title: 6 panel mosaic of NGC3372
